column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
long

A: Did you finish the book you were reading?
B: Yes. It was 900 pages. It's the {{c1::longest}} book I've ever read.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
honest

A: Sue always says what she thinks, doesn't she?
B: Yes, she's one of the {{c1::most honest}} people I know.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
good

A: Is Joe a good player?
B: Yes, very good. He's probably the {{c1::best}} in the team.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
hot

A: It was very warm yesterday, wasn't it?
B: Yes, I've heard it was the {{c1::hottest}} day of the year.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
sharp

A: This knife isn't very sharp. Do you have a sharper one?
B: No, it's the {{c1::sharpest}} knife I have.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
famous

A: Have you heard of the Louvre in Paris?
B: Yes, of course. It's one of the {{c1::most famous}} museums in the world.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
bad

A: How was your holiday?
B: Awful. It was the {{c1::worst}} holiday I've ever had.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the superlative.
column3:
short

A: What is a straight line?
B: It's the {{c1::shortest}} distance between two points.
